snippet: While the police said the man was refusing to drop scissors before being stunned, his girlfriend and the family’s lawyer say there were no scissors and he was catatonic when officers arrived.
abstract: Lawyer for family of Bronx man Mario Ocasio disputes official account of his death, saying he was not holding scissors or acting violently before police shocked him with Taser stun gun; police official confirms that Ocasio did not have scissors, but that Taser was deployed due to resistance on Ocasio's part after he was placed in handcuffs.
lead_paragraph: While the police said the man was refusing to drop scissors before being stunned, his girlfriend and the family’s lawyer say there were no scissors and he was catatonic when officers arrived.

headline.main: Family Disputes Police Account of Bronx Man’s Stun Gun Death
headline.print_headline: Lawyer Rebuts Police Account in Taser Death
